subject: Investing
title: What Volatility Really Means
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Volatility Really Means.

hook.text: The S&P 500 drops 10% at least once a year on average. Most investors are still surprised each time.

buildup.text: Volatility is the speed and magnitude of price changesâ€”both up and down.

discovery.text: High volatility means wider daily swings. A 1% day in bonds is rare; a 2% day in stocks is normal.

twist.text: Volatility is the price of admission for long-term stock returns. No turbulence, no altitude.

climax.text: Investors who accept volatility and stay invested earn the equity premium over full cycles.

punchline.text: Volatility is a feature, not a bug. Learn to live with it.

quiz.question: How often does the S&P 500 experience a 10% drop on average?
